intro: Lithospermum calcicola var. conzattii, commonly known as the Conzatti's lithospermum, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant red or purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
